active.description: Show/hides the environment presets component. Use this instead of using the visible attribute.
active.title: Active

dressing.description: Dressing is the term we use here for the set of additional objects that are put on the ground for decoration.
dressing.title: Dressing

dressingAmount.description: Number of objects used for dressing
dressingAmount.title: Dressing Amount

dressingOnPlayArea.description: Amount of dressing on play area.
dressingOnPlayArea.title: Dressing on Play Area

dressingUniformScale.description: If false, a different value is used for each coordinate x, y, z in the random variance of size.
dressingUniformScale.title: Dressing Uniform Scale

dressingVariance.description: Maximum x,y,z meters to randomize the size and rotation of each dressing object. Use 0 0 0 for no variation in size nor rotation.
dressingVariance.title: Dressing Variance

flatShading.description: Whether to show everything smoothed (false) or polygonal (true).
flatShading.title: Flat Shading

fog.description: Amount of fog (0 = none, 1 = full fog). The color is estimated automatically.
fog.title: Fog

grid.description: 1x1 and 2x2 are rectangular grids of 1 and 2 meters side, respectively.
grid.title: Grid

groundColor2.description: Secondary color of the ground. Used for textures, ignored if groundTexture is none.
groundColor2.title: Ground Color (secondary)

groundYScale.description: Maximum height (in meters) of ground's features (hills, mountains, peaks..).
groundYScale.title: Ground Features Height

hideInAR.description: If true, hide the environment when entering AR.
hideInAR.title: Hide when entering AR

lighting.description: A hemisphere light and a key light (directional or point) are added to the scene automatically when using the component. Use none if you don't want this automatic lighting set being added. The color and intensity are estimated automatically.
lighting.title: Lighting

lightPosition.description: Position of the main light. If skyType is atmospheric, only the orientation matters (is a directional light) and it can turn the scene into night when lowered towards the horizon.
lightPosition.title: Light Position

playArea.description: Radius of the area in the center reserved for the player and the gameplay. The ground is flat in there and no objects are placed inside.
playArea.title: Play Area

seed.description: Seed for randomization. If you don't like the layout of the elements, try another value for the seed.
seed.title: Randomization Seed

shadow.description: Shadows on/off. Sky light casts shadows on the ground of all those objects with shadow component applied
shadow.title: Shadow

shadowSize.description: Size of the shadow, if applied
shadowSize.title: Shadow size

gammaFactor.description: Gamma factor (three.js default is 2.0; we use 2.2 as default)
gammaFactor.title: Gamma Factor

localClippingEnabled.description: Defines whether the renderer respects object-level clipping planes
localClippingEnabled.title: Local Clipping Enabled

outputEncoding.description: Defines the output encoding of the renderer (three.js default is LinearEncoding; we use sRGBEncoding as default)
outputEncoding.title: Output Encoding

physicallyCorrectLights.description: Whether to use physically correct lighting mode.
physicallyCorrectLights.title: Physically Correct Lights

sortObjects.description: Defines whether the renderer should sort objects
sortObjects.title: Sort Objects

clickableOnlyEvents.description: true = publish only mouse events for objects with click-listeners; false = all objects publish mouse events
clickableOnlyEvents.title: Events Publish Behavior

distanceModel.description: Algorithm to use to reduce the volume of the audio source as it moves away from the listener
distanceModel.title: Positional Audio Distance Model

sceneHeadModel.description: Define a default model for the scene. You must scale and rotate your source GLTF appropriately.
sceneHeadModel.title: Head Model URL

jitsiHost.description: Jitsi host used for this scene.
jitsiHost.title: Scene Jitsi Host

maxAVDist.description: Maximum distance between cameras/users until audio and video are cut off. For saving bandwidth on scenes with large amounts of user activity at once
maxAVDist.title: Maximum Audio/Video Cut Off Distance

networkedLocationSolver.description: ARMarker location solver parameter. By default (networkedLocationSolver=false) clients solve camera location locally when a static marker is detected. When true, publishes marker detections (to realm/g/a/camera-name) and defers all tag solving of client camera to a solver sitting on pubsub.
networkedLocationSolver.title: Networked Location Solver

privateScene.description: false = scene will be visible; true = scene will not show in listings
privateScene.title: Scene Privacy

refDistance.description: Distance at which the volume reduction starts taking effect
refDistance.title: Positional Audio Reference Distance

rolloffFactor.description: How quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener
rolloffFactor.title: Positional Audio Rolloff Factor

screenshare.description: Name of the 3D object used when sharing desktop
screenshare.title: Screenshare object name

disableVideoCulling.description: If true will disable video frustum culling (video frustum culling stops video from users outside of view)
disableVideoCulling.title: Disable Video Frustum Culling

volume.description: Volume for users in a scene
volume.title: Positional Audio Volume

object_id.description: A uuid or otherwise unique identifier for this object

persist.description: Persist this object in the database

renderer-settings.description: These settings are fed into three.js WebGLRenderer properties
